CHEM 1111.heading: CHEM 1111 - Fundamentals of Chemistry Lab
CHEM 1111.prerequisite: Credit for or concurrent enrollment in CHEM 1311.
CHEM 1111.description: Illustrates and reinforces principles and concepts by use of qualitative and quantitative experiments, emphasizing interpretation and reporting of data and facility in handling scientific instruments.
CHEM 1111.note: Credit may not be applied toward a degree for both CHEM 1111 and CHEM 1105 or CHEM 1117.

CHEM 1311.heading: CHEM 1311 - Fundamentals of Chemistry
CHEM 1311.description: General principles, fundamental laws, atomic & molecular structure, states of matter, & elementary inorganic, nuclear & organic chemistry.
CHEM 1311.note: For science and engineering majors. May not be applied toward a degree until CHEM 1111 is successfully completed. Credit may not be applied to a degree for both CHEM 1311 and CHEM 1305 or CHEM 1372.

ENGI 1100.heading: ENGI 1100 - Introduction to Engineering
ENGI 1100.corequisite: May be taken concurrently with ENGL 1301.
ENGI 1100.description: A non-course competency-based option comprising 15-30 hours of mandatory individual tutoring to address developmental writing outcomes that students have not mastered. The tutoring supports the development of college-level writing through practice in the writing process.
ENGI 1100.note: Must be taken concurrently with ENGL 1301.

ENGL 1301.heading: ENGL 1301 - First Year Writing I
ENGL 1301.prerequisite: A TSI placement score of at least 340, and an essay score of at least a 4 on the TSI Writing Assessment; or a placement score of less than 340, and an ABE Diagnostic level of at least 4, and an essay score of at least 5 on the TSI Writing Assessment; and a score ranging from 351 to 390 on the TSI Reading Assessment. Students may exempt the TSI by obtaining satisfactory scores on other accepted standardized tests. See http://www.uh.edu/ussc/tsi/ for details.
ENGL 1301.note: Students who score below the minimum on the TSI must enroll concurrently in ENGL 1300 or, if slightly below the minimum writing score, in ENGL 1100. Students who score below the minimum on the TSI Reading Assessment must enroll concurrently in IRW 1300.

HIST 1301.description: The social, economic, and political history of the United States to 1877.

MATH 2413.heading: MATH 2413 - Calculus I
MATH 2413.prerequisite: Credit for MATH 2312 with a grade of C- or higher, or a satisfactory score on a placement examination.
MATH 2413.description: Calculus of rational functions, limits, derivatives, applications of the derivative, antiderivatives, the definite integral with applications, mean value theorem, fundamental theorem of calculus, and numerical integration.

ENGI 1331.heading: ENGI 1331 - Computing and Problem Solving for Engineers
ENGI 1331.prerequisite: ENGI 1100, MATH 2413 and CHEM 1311 OR PHYS 2325.
ENGI 1331.description: Engineering undergraduate standing or permission of the Director of Undergraduate Programs in Engineering. Introduction to computing; matrix arithmetic, programming constructs, algorithms and graphical visualization using MATLAB; problem solving applications in engineering analysis and design.

ENGL 1302.heading: ENGL 1302 - First Year Writing II
ENGL 1302.description: Detailed study of the principles of rhetoric as applied to analyzing and writing argumentative and persuasive essays; principles and methods of research, culminating in writing a substantial research paper.
ENGL 1302.note: Credit may not be received for both ENGL 1302 and ENGL 1310 or ENGL 1370.

HIST 1302.heading: HIST 1302 - The United States Since 1877
HIST 1302.description: The social, economic, and political history of the United States since 1877.

MATH 2414.heading: MATH 2414 - Calculus II
MATH 2414.prerequisite: Credit for MATH 2413 with a grade of C- or higher.
MATH 2414.description: Calculus of transcendental functions: additional techniques and applications of integration, indeterminate forms, improper integrals, Taylorâ€™s formula, and infinite series.

PHYS 2325.heading: PHYS 2325 - University Physics I
PHYS 2325.corequisite: Credit for or concurrent enrollment in MATH 2414.
PHYS 2325.description: First semester of a two part calculus-based course covering mechanics of one- and two-dimensional motion, dynamics, energy, momentum, rotational dynamics and kinematics, statics, gravity, oscillations, waves and fluids.
PHYS 2325.note: Primarily for science and engineering majors. Credit may not be applied toward degree for both PHYS 2325 and PHYS 1301.

PHYS 2125.heading: PHYS 2125 - University Physics Laboratory I
PHYS 2125.corequisite: Credit for or concurrent enrollment in PHYS 2325.
PHYS 2125.description: Experiments in mechanics and wave motion.
PHYS 2125.note: Credit may not be applied toward a degree for both PHYS 2125 and PHYS 1101.

ECE 2201.heading: ECE 2201 - Circuit Analysis I
ECE 2201.prerequisite: ENGI 1100, ENGI 1331, ENGL 1301 or ENGL 1309, ENGL 1302 or ENGL 1310, MATH 2413, MATH 2414, PHYS 2125, PHYS 2325.
ECE 2201.corequisite: MATH 2415, MATH 3321, or MATH 2318 and MATH 3331, PHYS 2126, and PHYS 2326.
ECE 2201.description: Analysis of resistive circuits, including node voltage and mesh current methods, and Thevenin and Norton equivalent circuits.

MATH 2415.heading: MATH 2415 - Calculus III
MATH 2415.description: Calculus of functions of several variables: calculus of vector-valued functions, partial differentiation, multiple integrals.

MATH 3321.heading: MATH 3321 - Engineering Mathematics
MATH 3321.description: First order ordinary differential equations and initial value problems; higher order differential equations; vector spaces, matrices, determinants, eigenvectors and eigenvalues; applications to systems of first order equations; Laplace transforms.
MATH 3321.note: Students may not receive credit for both MATH 3321 and MATH 3331.

PHYS 2326.heading: PHYS 2326 - University Physics II
PHYS 2326.corequisite: Credit for or concurrent enrollment in MATH 2415.
PHYS 2326.description: Second semester of a two part calculus-based course covering thermodynamics, electricity, magnetism, electromagnetic waves, optics, and modern physics.
PHYS 2326.note: Primarily for science and engineering majors. Credit may not be applied toward degree for both PHYS 2326 and PHYS 1302.

PHYS 2126.heading: PHYS 2126 - University Physics Laboratory II
PHYS 2126.corequisite: Credit for or concurrent enrollment in PHYS 2326.
PHYS 2126.description: Experiments in thermodynamics, electricity, magnetism, and optics.
PHYS 2126.note: Credit may not be applied toward a degree for PHYS 2126 and PHYS 1102.

GOVT 2306.heading: GOVT 2306 - U.S. & TX Constitution/Politics
GOVT 2306.description: Introduction to the constitutions and politics of the United States and Texas, emphasizing constitutional structure, federalism, separation of powers, limited government, public opinion, elections, and civil liberties. (Introductory category)

ENGI 2304.heading: ENGI 2304 - Technical Communications
ENGI 2304.prerequisite: ENGI 1100, ENGL 1302, engineering undergraduate standing, and completion of one of the following courses: ECE 2201, CHEE 2331, ENGR 2301, INDE 2333, MECE 2336, PETR 2311 or permission of the Director of Undergraduate Programs.
ENGI 2304.description: Engineering communication skills: written proposals, specifications, progress reports, and technical reports; individual and group oral presentations; essays on engineering ethics, contemporary engineering issues and the impact of engineering decisions.

ECE 2202.heading: ECE 2202 - Circuit Analysis II
ECE 2202.description: Analysis of electric circuits, including inductors, capacitors, and first order circuits; sinusoidal analysis.

ECE 2100.heading: ECE 2100 - Circuit Analysis Laboratory
ECE 2100.prerequisite: Credit for or concurrent enrollment in ECE 2202.
ECE 2100.description: Introduction to the electronics laboratory equipment. Introductory experiments in circuit analysis. Formal report writing. This laboratory course is a prerequisite for all other ECE laboratory courses.

ECE 3331.heading: ECE 3331 - Programming Applications in ECE
ECE 3331.prerequisite: MATH 3321 and credit for or concurrent enrollment in ECE 2201.
ECE 3331.description: Procedural programming in C and C++, with applications in electrical and computer engineering.

ECE 3441.heading: ECE 3441 - Digital Logic Design
ECE 3441.description: Boolean algebra, combinational logic, sequential machine analysis and synthesis.

COSC 1437.heading: COSC 1437 - Intro to Programming
COSC 1437.prerequisite: A grade of C- or better in COSC 1336, and credit for or concurrent enrollment in MATH 2413.
COSC 1437.description: Fundamental concepts of structured programming; procedures and elementary data structures with a focus on problem solving strategies and implementation; computer organization, structured procedural programming, C/C++ programming language, and algorithm design.

ECE 3155.heading: ECE 3155 - Electronics Lab
ECE 3155.prerequisite: ECE 2100 and ENGI 2304 and credit for or concurrent enrollment in ECE 3355.
ECE 3155.description: Laboratory projects concerning topics studied in electronics.

ECE 3355.heading: ECE 3355 - Electronics
ECE 3355.corequisite: Credit for or concurrent enrollment in ECE 3337 and ECE 3155.
ECE 3355.description: Signal and amplifier concepts; operational amplifiers; diodes and nonlinear circuits; bipolar junction transistors; biasing, small and large signal analysis; transistor amplifiers.

ECE 3436.heading: ECE 3436 - Microprocessors
ECE 3436.corequisite: Credit for or concurrent enrollment in ECE 2100.
ECE 3436.description: Memory devices, microcomputer architecture, assembly language programming, I/O programming, I/O interface design, data communications, and data acquisition systems. Laboratory exercises in assembly language and C.

ECE 3337.heading: ECE 3337 - Signal & System Analysis
ECE 3337.description: Time and frequency domain techniques for signals and systems analysis. Engineering applications of the convolution integral, Fourier series and transforms, and Laplace transforms.

ECE 3317.heading: ECE 3317 - Applied EM Waves
ECE 3317.description: Maxwellâ€™s equations in time and frequency domains, Poyntingâ€™s theorem, plane wave propagation, reflection and transmission in lossless and lossy media, transmission lines, waveguides, and antennas.

MATH 2305.heading: MATH 2305 - Discrete Math
MATH 2305.description: Topics selected from logic, set theory, combinatorics, and graph theory.

ECE 5367.heading: ECE 5367 - Intro to Comp Architecture Design
ECE 5367.description: Computer organization, computer arithmetic, instruction sets, programming with MIPS assembly language, CPU design, pipelining, and memory hierarchy including caching and virtual memory.

INDE 2333.heading: INDE 2333 - Engineering Statistics I
INDE 2333.description: Basic concepts of probability, discrete and continuous probability distributions, joint distributions for two random variables, covariance and correlation, descriptive statistics, and one-sample statistical inference (confidence interval and hypothesis testing) for engineering problems.

ECON 2302.heading: ECON 2302 - Principles of Microeconomics
ECON 2302.prerequisite: MATH 1314 or equivalent or consent of instructor.
ECON 2302.description: Individual consumer and firm behavior, supply and demand and the market determination or prices, production, and income. Includes government price ceilings, monopoly and antitrust, market failures and environmental pollution.

COSC 2436.heading: COSC 2436 - Programming and Data Structures
COSC 2436.prerequisite: A grade of C- or better in COSC 1437 and credit for or concurrent enrollment in MATH 2414.
COSC 2436.description: Introduction to fundamental data structures: arrays, lists, stacks, queues, hash tables, trees; sorting and searching; graph algorithms; design, analysis, and comparison of algorithms. Correctness verification techniques such as assertions and invariants. Review program specification, unit testing, and debugging.

ECE 4335.heading: ECE 4335 - ECE Design I
ECE 4335.prerequisite: ECE 3155, ECE 3317, ECE 3340, ECE 3355, ECE 3436, INDE 2333, and a core approved economics elective.
ECE 4335.description: Propose and begin team projects involving open-ended design problems supplied by industry and faculty. Professionalism, research methodologies, design tools, and technical communication.

ECE 3457.heading: ECE 3457 - Digital Electronics
ECE 3457.description: Analysis of discrete and integrated digital electronic devices and components and their use in the design and implementation of digital circuits.

GOVT 2305.heading: GOVT 2305 - U.S. Government
GOVT 2305.description: Introduction to the institutions of government with an emphasis on the congress, the president, and the federal courts. (Introductory category.)

ECE 4336.heading: ECE 4336 - ECE Design II
ECE 4336.description: Complete, construct, demonstrate, and defend team projects begun in ECE 4335.

COSC 4351.heading: COSC 4351 - Fundamentals of Software Engr
COSC 4351.prerequisite: COSC majors and minors: A grade of C- or better in COSC 3320 and MATH 3336; CpE majors: A grade of C- or better in COSC 2320 and MATH 3336.
COSC 4351.description: Introduction to the concepts of software engineering. Identification of problems related to the development of large software systems. Software project planning, requirements analysis, design, implementation, quality assurance and maintenance.
